data.enText: showing sth
an event, an action, a fact, etc. that shows that sth exists, is happening or may happen in the future

data.chText: 头痛可能是紧张的迹象。
data.enText: Headaches may be a sign of stress.

data.chText: 哪儿都没有约翰的影子。
data.enText: There is no sign of John anywhere.

data.chText: 一有闹事的苗头就叫警察。
data.enText: Call the police at the first sign of trouble.

data.chText: 阴沉的天气没有丝毫转晴的迹象。
data.enText: The gloomy weather shows no sign of improving.

data.chText: 她的工作出现了一些改进的迹象。
data.enText: Her work is showing some signs of improvement.

data.chText: 他没有马上拒绝，这是好征兆。
data.enText: The fact that he didn't say ‘no’ immediately is a good sign .

data.chText: 如果面试太简单，那必定表示你没得到那份工作。
data.enText: If an interview is too easy, it's a sure sign that you haven't got the job.

data.chText: 那座房子没有一点住人的迹象。
data.enText: There was no sign of life in the house (= there seemed to be nobody there) .

data.chText: 如果我注意到了那些预警征兆，这种事就一桩也不会发生了。
data.enText: If I had noticed the warning signs , none of this would have happened.
for information/warning
a piece of paper, wood or metal that has writing or a picture on it that gives you information, instructions, a warning, etc.
a road/traffic sign
a shop/pub sign

data.chText: 墙上的牌子上写着“请洗手”。
data.enText: The sign on the wall said ‘Now wash your hands’.

data.chText: 按照标牌的指示到市中心。
data.enText: Follow the signs for the city centre.
movement/sound

data.chText: 示意的动作（或声音）；手势
data.enText: a movement or sound that you make to tell sb sth

data.chText: 他竖起了大拇指表示赞同。
data.enText: He gave a thumbs-up sign .
She nodded as a sign for us to sit down.
symbol
a mark used to represent sth, especially in mathematics
a plus/minus sign (+/–)
a dollar/pound sign ($/£)
star sign
What sign are you?
a sign of the times
something that you feel shows what things are like now, especially how bad they are
your name
to write your name on a document, letter, etc. to show that you have written it, that you agree with what it says, or that it is genuine
Sign here, please.
Sign your name here, please.
You haven't signed the letter.
to sign a cheque
The treaty was signed on 24 March.

data.chText: 这名队员正在为一群球迷签名。
data.enText: The player was signing autographs for a group of fans.

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: He signed himself ‘Jimmy’.
contract
to arrange for sb, for example a sports player or musician, to sign a contract agreeing to work for your company; to sign a contract agreeing to work for a company

data.chText: 联队最近和一名新守门员签约。
data.enText: United have just signed a new goalie.
He signed for United yesterday.

data.chText: 乐队同维京唱片公司签了约。
data.enText: The band signed with Virgin Records.
make movement/sound
to make a request or tell sb to do sth by using a sign, especially a hand movement

data.chText: 旅馆经理示意行李工替我拿箱子。
data.enText: The hotel manager signed to the porter to pick up my case.
for deaf person
to use sign language to communicate with sb

data.chText: 为帮助她耳聋的孩子，她学会了手语。
data.enText: She learnt to sign to help her deaf child.

data.chText: 现在越来越多的戏剧配上了手语。
data.enText: An increasing number of plays are now being signed.
the signers of the petition

data.chText: 向聋人传递信息的手语译员
data.enText: signers communicating information to deaf people
signed and sealed
signed, sealed and delivered

data.chText: 签名盖章完毕的；铁定的；成定局的
data.enText: definite, because all the legal documents have been signed
sign on the dotted line

data.chText: 在签字处签上姓名（表示同意）；签名同意
data.enText: to sign a document to show that you have agreed to buy sth or do sth

data.chText: 只要大笔一挥签个字，这车就归你了。
data.enText: Just sign on the dotted line and the car is yours.
sign/take the pledge
to make a promise never to drink alcohol
sign sth↔away

data.chText: 签字放弃，签字让与（权利或财产）
data.enText: to lose your rights or property by signing a document
sign for sth
to sign a document to show that you have received sth
sign in/out
sign sb↔in/out

data.chText: 签到 / 退；替…签到 / 签退
data.enText: to write your/sb's name when you arrive at or leave an office, a club, etc.
All visitors must sign in on arrival.

data.chText: 客人离开俱乐部时，你必须为他们签退。
data.enText: You must sign guests out when they leave the club.
sign off
to end a letter

data.chText: 她在信末写上“你的珍妮特”。
data.enText: She signed off with ‘Yours, Janet’.

data.chText: （以说再见或播放音乐的形式）结束广播
data.enText: to end a broadcast by saying goodbye or playing a piece of music
sign sth↔off
to give your formal approval to sth, by signing your name
sign off on sth
to express your approval of sth formally and definitely

data.chText: 这份报告总统尚未批准。
data.enText: The President hasn't signed off on this report.
sign on

data.chText: 办理失业登记（以领取失业救济金）
data.enText: to sign a form stating that you are an unemployed person so that you can receive payment from the government
sign on/up
sign sb↔on/up
to sign a form or contract which says that you agree to do a job or become a soldier; to persuade sb to sign a form or contract like this

data.chText: 他签了在部队服役五年的合同。
data.enText: He signed on for five years in the army.

data.chText: 为时装表演，公司签约聘了三名顶尖模特儿。
data.enText: The company has signed up three top models for the fashion show.
sign sth↔over (to sb)
to give your rights or property to sb else by signing a document

data.chText: 她签署了转让手续，把房子过到女儿名下。
data.enText: She has signed the house over to her daughter.
sign up (for sth)
to arrange to do a course of study by adding your name to the list of people doing it

data.text: sign ♦ indication ♦ symptom ♦ symbol ♦ indicator ♦ signal

data.chText: 以上各词均指迹象、征兆、预兆。
data.enText: These are all words for an event, action or fact that shows that sth exists, is happening or may happen in the future.
sign
an event, action or fact that shows that sth exists, is happening or may happen in the future

data.chText: 头痛可能是紧张的迹象。
data.enText: Headaches may be a sign of stress.
indication
( rather formal ) a remark or sign that shows that sth is happening or what sb is thinking or feeling

data.chText: 他们根本没说明这项工作该怎样做。
data.enText: They gave no indication as to how the work should be done.

data.chText: indication常通过某人的说话表明，而sign通常为发生的事或某人所做的事。
data.enText: An indication often comes in the form of sth that sb says, while a sign is usually sth that happens or sth that sb does.
sign or indication?
symptom
a change in your body or mind that shows that you are not healthy; a sign that sth exists, especially sth bad
Symptoms include a sore throat.

data.chText: 通胀上升不过是经济不景气的一个征候。
data.enText: The rise in inflation was just one symptom of the poor state of the economy.
symbol
a person, object or event that represents a more general quality or situation

data.chText: 鸽子是和平的共同象征。
data.enText: The dove is a universal symbol of peace.
indicator
( rather formal ) a sign that shows you what sth is like or how a situation is changing
the economic indicators
signal
an event, action or fact that shows that sth exists, is happening or may happen in the future

data.chText: 胸部疼痛可能是心脏病的报警信号。
data.enText: Chest pains can be a warning signal of heart problems.

data.chText: signal常用以指应该采取行动的暗号、信号；sign通常不用于此义：
data.enText: Signal is often used to talk about an event, action or fact that suggests to sb that they should do sth. Sign is not usually used in this way.
Reducing prison sentences would send the wrong signs to criminals.
sign or signal?
a(n) sign/indication/symptom/symbol/indicator/signal of sth
a(n) sign/indication/indicator/signal that…
a(n) clear/definite/distinct/obvious sign/indication/symptom/indicator/signal
an early sign/indication/symptom/indicator/signal
an outward sign/indication/symptom/symbol
to give a(n) sign/indication/signal
A sign/symbol means sth.
All the signs/indications are/point to…

ex.chText: 他在文件/支票上签了字。
ex.enText: He signed his name on the paper/check.

ex.chText: 双方准备签署合同。
ex.enText: Both sides are ready to sign the contract.

ex.chText: 这幅画没有签名，不知道是谁画的。
ex.enText: The painting isn't signed so we don't know who it's by.

synonyms.bx: 指在文件、合同、签到簿等上签名，表示同意、批准或出席，或在作品上署名，表示是某人所作。

ex.chText: 已准备好书让作者在上面签名。
ex.enText: The book is ready to be autographed by the writer.

ex.chText: 他得到了一个有全体队员签名的篮球。
ex.enText: He's got a basketball autographed by the whole team.

synonyms.bx: 指名人在书籍、照片等上签名。

ex.chText: 她已在这支票背面签名。
ex.enText: She has already endorsed the check.

ex.chText: 该票据需要背书。
ex.enText: The bill needs to be endorsed.

synonyms.bx: 指在支票、票据等背面签名。

ex.chText: 在页边做个记号。
ex.enText: Make a mark at the margin.

ex.chText: 为什么这件银器上有他的印记？
ex.enText: Why does this piece of silver bear his mark?

synonyms.bx: 指写下来或印在物体上的记号。

ex.chText: ￡是表示英镑的符号。
ex.enText: ￡ is the sign for the British pound.

ex.chText: “+”表示加号。
ex.enText: '+' is the plus sign.

synonyms.bx: 指具有某种特殊含义的记号或形状。

ex.chText: 这些都是语音符号。
ex.enText: These are the phonetic symbols.

ex.chText: 铁的化学符号是哪个？
ex.enText: What is the chemical symbol for iron?

synonyms.bx: 指表示声音、数量、化学物质等的字母、数字或记号。

ex.chText: 警方已经找到强盗的一些踪迹。
ex.enText: The police found some traces of the robbers.

ex.chText: 杀手消失得无影无踪。
ex.enText: The killer disappeared without a trace.

ex.chText: 他的血液中未有毒品存在的任何迹象。
ex.enText: There was no trace of any drugs in his blood.

synonyms.bx: 指某人、某物曾经出现或存在过的迹象。

ex.chText: 最后她找到了解开那个谜的头绪。
ex.enText: At last she found a clue to the puzzle.

ex.chText: 有我们能用来找到凶手的线索吗？
ex.enText: Are there any clues we can use to find the murderer?

ex.chText: 我们对她离家后去往何处毫无线索。
ex.enText: We have no clue as to where she went after she left home.

synonyms.bx: 指帮助弄清事情缘由或帮助破案、解开谜团的线索。

ex.chText: 乌云是大雨将至的预兆。
ex.enText: Dark clouds are the sign of heavy rain.

ex.chText: 一有危险迹象，潜艇就会潜入水中。
ex.enText: At the first sign of danger, the submarine will submerge.

ex.chText: 那儿没有设置路障的迹象。
ex.enText: There was no sign of a roadblock.

synonyms.bx: 指某事属实、即将发生或存在着的迹象。

trans: （在信的结尾）写结束语；（挂电话、广播节目结束时）就说到这儿，到此为止
注销（领取失业救济金的）登记
办理失业登记（以领取失业救济金）

tr: structure displaying a board on which advertisements can be posted
example: the highway was lined with signboards

tr: a perceptible indication of something not immediately apparent (as a visible clue that something has happened)
example: he showed signs of strain
they welcomed the signs of spring

tr: any nonverbal action or gesture that encodes a message
example: signals from the boat suddenly stopped

tr: a public display of a message
example: he posted signs in all the shop windows

tr: a character indicating a relation between quantities
example: don't forget the minus sign

tr: a gesture that is part of a sign language
a fundamental linguistic unit linking a signifier to that which is signified
example: The bond between the signifier and the signified is arbitrary"--de Saussur

tr: an event that is experienced as indicating important things to come
example: he hoped it was an augury
it was a sign from God

tr: (astrology) one of 12 equal areas into which the zodiac is divided
having an indicated pole (as the distinction between positive and negative electric charges)
example: he got the polarity of the battery reversed
charges of opposite sign

tr: (medicine) any objective evidence of the presence of a disorder or disease
example: there were no signs of asphyxiation

tr: make the sign of the cross over someone in order to call on God for protection
consecrate
be engaged by a written agreement
example: He signed to play the casino on Dec. 18
The soprano signed to sing the new opera

tr: communicate in sign language
example: I don't know how to sign, so I could not communicate with my deaf cousin

tr: mark with one's signature
write one's name (on)
example: She signed the letter and sent it off
Please sign here

tr: communicate silently and non-verbally by signals or signs
example: He signed his disapproval with a dismissive hand gesture
The diner signaled the waiters to bring the menu

tr: place signs, as along a road
example: sign an intersection
This road has been signed

tr: engage by written agreement
example: They signed two new pitchers for the next season

tr: approve and express assent, responsibility, or obligation
example: All parties ratified the peace treaty
Have you signed your contract yet?

value.def: A sign is a mark or shape that always has a particular meaning, for example in mathematics or music.

example.ex: Equations are generally written with a two-bar equals sign.
example.tran: 等式通常用两道横的等号来表示。

value.def: A sign is a movement of your arms, hands, or head which is intended to have a particular meaning.

example.ex: They gave Lavalle the thumbs-up sign...
example.tran: 他们对拉瓦列竖起了大拇指。

example.ex: The priest made the sign of the cross over him.
example.tran: 神父在他上方画了个十字。

value.def: If you sign, you communicate with someone using sign language. If a programme or performance is signed, someone uses sign language so that deaf people can understand it.

example.ex: All programmes will be either 'signed' or subtitled...
example.tran: 所有节目要么要配手语要么要打字幕。

value.tran: 打手势语;为(节目或表演)配手语

value.def: A sign is a piece of wood, metal, or plastic with words or pictures on it. Signs give you information about something, or give you a warning or an instruction.

example.ex: ...a sign saying that the highway was closed because of snow.
example.tran: 声明公路因大雪而关闭的告示牌

example.ex: ...a cardboard sign, which stated 'No to Poll Tax'...
example.tran: 写有“反对人头税”的硬纸板抗议牌

example.ex: As soon as the seat belt sign had been switched off, we rushed out.
example.tran: 安全带指示灯一关掉，我们就冲了出去。

value.tran: 招牌;标牌;指示牌;告示牌;标志

value.def: If there is a sign of something, there is something which shows that it exists or is happening.

example.ex: They are prepared to hand back a hundred prisoners of war a day as a sign of good will...
example.tran: 他们准备每日遣返100名战俘以示友好。

example.ex: His face and movements rarely betrayed a sign of nerves...
example.tran: 他的表情和行为几乎没有流露出紧张的迹象。

example.ex: Your blood would have been checked for any sign of kidney failure.
example.tran: 应该要对你进行抽血检查的，看是否有任何肾衰竭的迹象。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>of</l> n

value.def: When you sign a document, you write your name on it, usually at the end or in a special space. You do this to indicate that you have written the document, that you agree with what is written, or that you were present as a witness.

example.ex: World leaders are expected to sign a treaty pledging to increase environmental protection...
example.tran: 世界各国首脑预计会签署一份承诺加强环境保护的协定。

example.ex: Before an operation the patient will be asked to sign a consent form.
example.tran: 手术前患者将被要求在同意书上签字。

value.tran: 在…上签名;在…上签字;签署

value.def: If an organization signs someone or if someone signs for an organization, they sign a contract agreeing to work for that organization for a specified period of time.

example.ex: The Minnesota Vikings signed Herschel Walker from the Dallas Cowboys...
example.tran: 明尼苏达维京人队签下了来自达拉斯牛仔队的赫舍尔·沃克。

example.ex: The band then signed to Slash Records.
example.tran: 随后乐队和伤痕唱片公司签约。

value.def: In astrology, a sign or a sign of the zodiac is one of the twelve areas into which the heavens are divided.

example.ex: The New Moon takes place in your opposite sign of Libra on the 15th.
example.tran: 15 日新月会移至你对面的天秤宫。

value.def: If you say that there is no sign of someone, you mean that they have not yet arrived, although you are expecting them to come.

example.ex: The London train was on time, but there was no sign of my Finnish friend.
example.tran: 伦敦的火车准点到达，却不见我那芬兰朋友的踪影。

value.def: If you say that an agreement is signed and sealed, or signed, sealed and delivered, you mean that it is absolutely definite because everyone involved has signed all the legal documents.

example.ex: The Chancellor had been hoping to have an agreement signed and sealed by the end of this week...
example.tran: 财政大臣一直期望这周末前能敲定一份协议。

example.ex: A government spokesman said the bill must be signed, sealed and delivered by tomorrow.
example.tran: 一名政府发言人称议案明天必须定下来。

value.tran: 已签字盖章的;已成定局的

trans: 注册；（和…）签约；雇用；报名（参加课程）
办理失业登记（以领取失业救济金）
报名参加；学生会报名；注册，选课
神迹奇事；神蹟奇事；神迹奇事运动；神蹟和奇事；神迹和奇事
交通標誌；交通指示牌；交通标志；交通标识；交通信号
（在信的结尾）写结束语；（挂电话、广播节目结束时）就说到这儿，到此为止；注销（领取失业救济金的）登记
星座；黄道宫；十二生肖；生肖
